page.title: 16HOMELIFE:OLD FOLKS HOME
page.content: Churchlands Old People's Home is run by Kent County Council and has 61 residents. There are far more elderly ladies than men. This shows that women have a greater life expectancy than men. Churchlands is a home for the physically infirm and some of the residents are senile,which means that their brains do not get enough blood. People living there have all kinds of conditions ranging from arthritis to strokes. The home opened in 1966,so it is now 19 years old. Some of the residents share rooms but about 20 have their own rooms. The old people give their pensions to the people who run the homes and they get about 8 pounds a week in pocket money. There are no restrictions on visiting hours. The people spend much of the day sitting staring alone with their memories.
